habitat_description:
The range of this species expands from southeastern North Carolina, south into most of the coastal plain, through Florida, west and central Georgia, Alabama, southern Mississippi, and southeastern Louisiana. Also, from central and northern Louisiana and southwestern Arkansas, and west into Texas. 

In Mexico, this species ranges from eastern Coahuila, northeastern Nuevo Leon, Tamaulipas, San Luis Potosi, eastern Guanajuato, Queretaro and Hidalgo (Ernst 1992). The habitats of this species include hardwood forest, pine/oak woodland, pine flatwoods, xerophytic scrub, and sandy areas (Ernst and Ernst 2003, Tennant 1997).

Eggs are laid in loose sandy soils in association with decaying matter (Mount 1975).

Habitat destruction and motorized vehicles are potentially the most serious threats (Ernst 1992, Ernst and Ernst 2003). Natureserve.org documents the decline of this species in Alabama due to introduction of the fire ant (Mount 1981, as reported on natureserve.org).

SE-Conifer forest, hardwood forest, savanna, shrubland, chaparral, various woodlands; pine-oak, hardwood. Also found on pine flatwoods, xerophytic scrub, marsh edges, and residential areas.
